note: Conservation advocate and amateur bird photographer. Ohioan by birth, Coloradan by choice, living near the nation’s capital. I took and own all photos posted here. No reuse or reference without permission.

I've been exploring of the natural world from boyhood, and photographing #nature and #wildlife for over 40 years. Here to share images, info and insights, along with conservation messages and a sense of humour.

Header image: Ten Puffins (one lying down, the others standing, most facing towards the right of the image) on a Skomer clifftop.

Avatar: A Peacock Butterfly on white Buddleia flowers.

Mostly I'm going to post photos of birds, with the occasional other creature thrown in. Scenery and humans are a rarity. All photos my own and most taken in Perth or around Western Australia unless specified. #birds #photography #birdphotography #nature

If he admits he has drawn a new comic, I seize it and post it right here before Randall shoots me down with a drone.

DM "#subscribe" to receive xkcd hot and fresh in your inbox. DM "#unsubscribe" to stop.

Pictures of Mountains & Molehills, Fungi & Feathered things and whatever nature puts in front of my camera. Outside is my favourite place. Except when it's raining.

All pictures are my own, all identifications are subject to being wrong. I know a little bit about everything but make no claims to be an expert in anything.

My Life in Positive Hashtags: #Walking #Mountains #Photography #Nature #Fungi #Birds #Yorkshire #Tea #Coffee #Beer #RealAle #fedi22

No Politics, Sport, Hate, Negativity etc.

LabPlot is a FREE, open source and cross-platform data visualization and analysis software accessible to everyone and trusted by professionals.

• High-quality interactive plotting
• Reliable and easy data analysis, statistics, regression, curve and peak fitting
• Computing with interactive Notebooks (Python R Julia Octave and more)
• Data extraction from plots and support for real-time data
• Smooth data import and export (many file formats)
• Runs on Windows, macOS, Linux, FreeBSD, Haiku

display_name: MPI for the Science of Light
note:
The Max Planck Institute for the Science of Light (MPL) focuses on basic research into all aspects of the interaction between light and matter, from modern optics to photonics, quantum effects and their applications in the "real" world. It aims to extend the realm of the possible in the science and technology of light.

For content in German, geared towards a more general audience, you can also follow us @MPI_PhysikDesLichts

Title Image by Alex Griesch
